newsitem.title: UK: OPEC face $600 bln CO2 tax bill by 2020 - official.
newsitem.headline: OPEC face $600 bln CO2 tax bill by 2020 - official.

text.p: OPEC members could lose nearly $600 billion in cumulative revenues by the year 2020 if a tax on carbon dioxide emissions is implemented, an OPEC official said.

According to the OPEC News Agency, Stefan Balabanoff, head of the economics section in OPEC's economics and finance department, told an industry seminar that global warming was at this stage "just a theory."
To blame the burning of fossil fuels for global warming "constitutes a clear misrepresentation of the state of the global warming debate," he said.
In most OPEC member countries, oil exports made up more than 80 percent of total exports, with the OPEC average being 68 percent, Balabanoff said.
A carbon tax would cause a "dramatic fall in future OPEC production levels," he said.

"The higher the carbon tax imposed, the greater the loss in OPEC revenues, with the maximum loss occurring under the $300 per tonne tax, with a weak price and oil tariff scenario, under which OPEC members would lose about $250 billion by 2010 and almost $600 billion by 2020."
